name: Path Tracing
shortDescription: Physically-based light simulation that traces rays through a scene to produce photorealistic images.

name: Rasterization
shortDescription: The dominant real-time technique that projects 3D triangles onto a 2D screen at interactive frame rates.

name: Neural Radiance Fields
shortDescription: Neural networks that learn a volumetric scene representation from a set of photographs.

name: 3D Gaussian Splatting
shortDescription: An explicit point-based representation that renders novel views in real time using differentiable Gaussian primitives.

name: Volume Rendering
shortDescription: Techniques for visualizing 3D scalar fields like CT scans, fluid simulations, and participating media.

name: Differentiable Rendering
shortDescription: Rendering with computable gradients, enabling optimization of 3D scene parameters through gradient descent.

name: Ray Marching & SDFs
shortDescription: Iterative ray stepping through signed distance fields, popular for procedural geometry and real-time effects.
